author: Staff Reporter
text:
Faculty of State Government-aided colleges staged a protest here on Wednesday urging the Higher Education Department to fill the 3,120 vacancies in teaching posts in aided colleges.

The faculty, who had gathered under the aegis of the Association of University Teachers – Joint Action Council, Tamil Nadu Government College Teachers’ Association and a few other bodies, said that the department as per Government Order 79 should fill the vacancies in a transparent manner.

Inquiry sought

They urged the Government to conduct an inquiry by a High Court judge into vacancies that were filled up after 2011 May.

Their other demands were to nominate a Vice-Chancellor for the Thanjavur Tamil University, provide career enhancement with retrospective effect for those faculty appointed after January 1, 2006 by fixing eligibility criteria, implement the orders found in letters of Collegiate Education Director related to removing discrepancies in wages for junior and senior staff and fix Rs. 14,940 as basic pay for selection grade lecturers. They also sought wages salary for faculty in self-financed, university colleges and constituent colleges as per UGC norms and a ban on contributory pension scheme.

Nearly 400 faculty staged the protest in front of the office of the Regional Joint Director of Collegiate Education until the Coimbatore City Police removed them.
title: Fill vacancies in aided colleges: faculty
